result.execSummary:
The defendant Kim T. Livingston was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Costs to be paid at a rate of $25.00 per month commencing 11/1/22 and each month thereafter.  Penalty of civil judgment for non-payment.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kim T. Livingston

records.addlTxt: Court's response letter sent to the State Public Defender Appellate Division with copy of the Notice of Intent, JOC and Court Reporter list attached.
Filed by Atty Crawford
records.descr: Notice of intent to pursue post-conviction relief

records.addlTxt: Treatment letters from Froedtert and Sixteenth Street clinic filed.

10:17 AM  Case is called for a plea and sentencing. Defendant Kim T. Livingston in court.  Attorney Paul S. Crawford in court for Kim T. Livingston.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court notes the State has filed an amended Information.  Atty Crawford acknowledges receipt, waives reading and enters an initial not guilty plea.
Court notes plea questionnaire has been filed and reviews the offer as listed in the document.  State and defense confirm the offer.

Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant. Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1 of the Amended Information,  Court finds defendant guilty of Count 1.  Court orders Count 2 dismissed and read in. Court also orders case 22CF548 dismissed and read in to this case.

Sentencing arguments made by the State.
Sentencing arguments made by Attorney Crawford
Defendant presents statements

COUNT 1:

The Court Orders the Following:

COSTS: $ 243
	
DNA Surcharge: $200

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
 
Total costs: to be paid at the rate of $25 per month commencing 11/1/22.   Failure to pay: will result in a civil judgment.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:17 AM; Case called for Hearing. Prosecuting attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kim T. Livingston in court.  Attorney Paul S. Crawford appeared by video for Kim T. Livingston.   All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. Atty. Crawford provides an update; parties have resolved the matter and is asking for a plea and sentencing date at the end of this month.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on September 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Hearing on September 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:48 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Kim T. Livingston in court with attorney Paul S. Crawford.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Craford provides an update, he is working to get a global resolution from the ADA assigned to the case and discuss some medical issues as well.  Atty. Crawford requests a further proceedings date.  State confirms there is no global offer and has no objection to adjourning for further proceedings.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.  Hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Hearing on June 30, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Defendant waives her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

10:56 AM Defendant Kim T. Livingston in court with attorney Paul S. Crawford.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 20, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

08:46 AM Defendant Kim T. Livingston in court with attorney Paul S. Crawford.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Charlie Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: Atty. Paul Crawford
Initial appearance on March 10, 2022 at 08:15 am.

09:37 AM Defendant Kim T. Livingston in court.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Court conducts colloquy with the defendant as to having any drugs or alcohol today as the defendant has fallen asleep multiple times.  The Court has concerns and will not continue with the initial appearance.  The Court orders the defendant not to leave the Courtroom so medical personel may check on her well being prior to leaving the courthouse today.  Initial appearance scheduled for March 10, 2022 at 08:15 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
